action.action-desc: Mr. Moore of Utah introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To temporarily increase funding to the Court Improvement Program, to improve the ability of courts to conduct remote child welfare proceedings, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Connecting Forever Families Act of 2022.

section.header: Temporary additional funding for the court improvement program

subsection.text: Section 436 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 629f) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by inserting , $375,000,000 for each fiscal year in the 5-fiscal-year period beginning with the 1st fiscal year beginning after the effective date of the Connecting Forever Families Act of 2022, and $345,000,000 for each succeeding fiscal year before the period; and

in subsection (b)(2), by inserting until the 1st fiscal year beginning after the effective date of the Connecting Forever Families Act of 2022, $60,000,000 for the grants for each fiscal year in the 5-fiscal-year period beginning with the 1st fiscal year after such effective date, and $30,000,000 for the grants for each succeeding fiscal year before the period.

subsection.text: Section 438(c)(3) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 629h(c)(3)) is amended by inserting for each fiscal year that begins before the effective date of the Connecting Forever Families Act of 2022, $2,000,000 in the case of the 1st 5 fiscal years that begin after such effective date, and $1,000,000 for each succeeding fiscal year, after $1,000,000.

paragraph.text: Effective on October 1 of the 1st fiscal year beginning after the effective date of this Act, section 403(b)(2) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 603(b)(2)) is amended by striking $608,000,000 and inserting $448,000,000.
Effective on October 1 of the 2nd fiscal year beginning after such effective date, section 403(b)(2) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 603(b)(2)) is amended by striking $448,000,000 and inserting $618,000,000.
Effective on October 1 of the 3rd fiscal year beginning after such effective date, section 403(b)(2) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 603(b)(2)) is amended by striking $618,000,000 and inserting $608,000,000.

section.header: Clarification that court improvement program funds may be used for technological improvements to prevent disruption and enable recovery from various threats
section.text: Section 438(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 629h(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking and at the end of paragraph (1);
by striking the period at the end of paragraph (2) and inserting and; and
by adding at the end the following:

to prevent disruption and enable recovery from threats such as public health crises, natural disasters, or cyber-attacks, including technology support for remote hearings or legal representation, developing guidance, coordinating with other agencies, or otherwise ensuring back-up approaches are in place to ensure continuity of needed services.

section.header: Implementation guidance on sharing best practices for technological changes needed for court proceedings for foster care or adoption to be conducted remotely

subsection.text: Every 5 years, the Secretary of Health and Human Services, through the Administration for Children and Families, shall issue implementation guidance for sharing information on the best practices for—

paragraph.text: technological changes needed for court proceedings for foster care or adoption to be conducted remotely in a way that maximizes engagement and protects the privacy of participants; and
the manner in which the proceedings should be conducted.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Health and Human Services shall issue the 1st guidance required by subsection (a) not later than January 1, 2024.

section.text: Except as provided in section 2(b), this Act and the amendments made by this Act shall take effect on the date that is 6 months after the date of the enactment of this Act.
